rrq.kelp 0.1.0
  • Reference

SeaweedFS-based rrq offload

Source: R/kelp_store.R
object_store_kelp.Rd

SeaweedFS-based rrq offload

SeaweedFS-based rrq offload

Details

A SeaweedFS-based offload for rrq::object_store. This is not intended at all for direct user-use.

Methods

Public methods

  • object_store_kelp$new()

  • object_store_kelp$mset()

  • object_store_kelp$mget()

  • object_store_kelp$mdel()

  • object_store_kelp$list()

  • object_store_kelp$destroy()

Method new()

Create the store

Usage

object_store_kelp$new(seaweed_master_url, con, queue_id)

Arguments

seaweed_master_url

URL to access seaweed master API

con

A redis connection

queue_id

Id of the queue, used as namespace for stored objects

Method mset()

Save a number of values to SeaweedFS

Usage

object_store_kelp$mset(hash, value)

Arguments

hash

A character vector of object hashes

value

A list of serialised objects (each of which is a raw vector)

Method mget()

Retrieve a number of objects from SeaweedFS

Usage

object_store_kelp$mget(hash)

Arguments

hash

A character vector of hashes of the objects to return. The objects will be deserialised before return.

Method mdel()

Delete a number of objects from SeaweedFS

Usage

object_store_kelp$mdel(hash)

Arguments

hash

A character vector of hashes to remove

Method list()

List hashes stored in this offload store

Usage

object_store_kelp$list()

Method destroy()

Completely delete the store by removing the entire collection from SeaweedFS and removing all data from redis.

Usage

object_store_kelp$destroy()

Contents
